abstract: In a deal that seems to have won only praise from analysts, Business Objects, a French-American software company, said it would acquire Cartesis for about $300 million in cash, bolstering its presence in financial enterprise software. Business Objects, which makes so-called business intelligence software, has felt pressure to cut a deal since Oracle bought a rival, Hyperion Solutions, for $3.3 billion last month.
lead_paragraph: In a deal that seems to have won only praise from analysts, Business Objects, a French-American software company, said it would acquire Cartesis for about $300 million in cash, bolstering its presence in financial enterprise software. Business Objects, which makes so-called business intelligence software, has felt pressure to cut a deal since Oracle bought a rival, Hyperion Solutions, for $3.3 billion last month.

headline.main: Business Objects to Buy Cartesis for $300 Million
